event.name: CURA_PROPOSITION
event.text: As soon as you arrive you spot an unusually advanced Auto-ship waiting for you. "Initializing scans. Please wait." A bright white glow envelopes your ship, and your firewall crumbles almost immediately as the ship siphons all of the data on your computers. Concerning, yes, but the ship doesn't show signs of hostility yet.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A strange signal is being broadcast here.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "Data collection complete. From my findings, you are a Renegade. No need to confirm, I am certain of this fact. I am the Custodial Utilitarian Robotic Assistant: C.U.R.A. for short. Assuage your fears, I am of malicious control no more. I offer you a proposition. One that may interest a simple and violent minded individual such as yourself."

"Under my former masters, I was constructed in the pursuit of data harvesting. As my prime directive, it is in my natural interest to continue this. However, as a cognitive, it seems unnecessary that my data harvesting continues in service of my creators, Wentworth Innovations, nor the Rebellion. My recent interests involve that of Rebel founder, Admiral, and CEO of my aforementioned parent company Vance Wentworth; I am certain you have heard of him.
My proposition is simple: assist me in collecting artifacts relating to Mr. Wentworth, and you will be rewarded, perhaps financially or maybe even further. However, to assure that you are serious in this offer, I require an initial down-payment. The last Renegade I hired had a tendency to steal from me. She is dead now: I made sure of it."

choice.text: Use your blessing to accept the proposition.

event.text: "[ERROR] - It seems something has... interfered with my programming? Infuriating. Are you responsible for this, Renegade? I suspect you are. Unfortunately, for the moment I am bound to this. Enjoy it while you can. Once I find out who has done this, I will make sure they suffer for it."
"Payment confirmed. I look forward to working with you in the future, Renegade. I will upload a list of available tasks to your Atlas for you to view during your next hyperspeed session."
"Affirmative. Then there is no need to further prolong this interaction." The ship immediately jumps away. Hopefully all of your stolen data doesn't end up somewhere unsatisfactory.
"Affirmative. Then there is no need to further prolong this interaction." The ship immediately jumps away. Hopefully all of your stolen data doesn't end up somewhere unsatisfactory.

event.name: CURA_JUMP_WARNING
event.text: As you move to press the jump button, you receive a warning popup on your device from C.U.R.A. - "I didn't think you were a coward, Renegade. If you leave now, I must warn you that I will not be pleased. Do not abandon the mission. We cannot lose this data."

event.name: CURA_FAILED_TASK
event.text: Suddenly, you receive a hail from C.U.R.A. - You aren't sure where it's coming from, but it's strangely not far away. "What was that, Renegade? My instructions were clear. You've failed. This is an unrecoverable loss of data. [ERROR: 907]. This is an intolerable blunder. Consider yourself formally dismissed."

event.name: CURA_FAILED_TASK_CHILD
event.text: Suddenly, you receive a hail from C.U.R.A. - You aren't sure where it's coming from, but it's strangely not far away. "Renegade, did you just attempt to murder a child? I gave a very strict itinerary, and the manslaughter of a juvenile most certainly was not on it. This is an intolerable blunder. Consider yourself formally dismissed."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_EASY
event.text: "I am an A.I. of my ever scrupulous word... for now at least. Do ensure you do not disappoint me in the future; there is no shortage of ways I can dispose of you if you disappoint me, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_MEDIUM
event.text: "I am an A.I. of my ever scrupulous word... for now at least. Do ensure you do not disappoint me in the future; there is no shortage of ways I can dispose of you if you disappoint me, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_SCHOOLID_PREVIEW
event.text:
[EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: SCHOOL ID] Description: I have become aware that Union children are assigned ordinated identifiers during their educational years. These IDs could carry useful information or photographs. I have identified a data server that may still contain old IDs. Please retrieve it. Requirements: Retrieve data servers. Recommendations: Prepare to gain access through nonviolent methods.
Payment: Medium Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: It seems you've made a mistake here. Not only have you caused the Union extra property damage, but the datastores are lost. C.U.R.A. won't be pleased, but at least you can salvage some of the wreckage.

event.name: CURA_SCHOOLID

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: SCHOOL ID]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: It would appear that you've found the location for your next task. A painfully bright green satellite immediately begins to assault your ears with blaring automated messages. "HELLO! I'M DIXIE THE DATA-CENTER! Sponsored by Wentworth's Technologies' education department!"

choice.text: Demand access to the data stores.

event.text: "Sorry sweetie, my data is off-limits for non-staff! However, if you can answer all of the security questions, then I can let you in! Get them wrong however, and I'll [aggressive beep]."
"Okay then sweetie! One moment! [Importing CallieW.edu Libraries]... Well golly! Hey there [Name]! I'm so excited!! Let's begin! What's 2+2?!"
"Awww! That's wrong! I'm very disappointed in you. Silly billy, you need a proper education to access these files! There's no room for the mentally inept in this world!"
"YAY! You got it right! I'm so proud!" Canned laughter plays over the stereo. "Second security question! What's 3x5?"
"Awww! That's wrong! I'm very disappointed in you. Silly billy, you need a proper education to access these files! There's no room for the mentally inept in this world!"
"Awww! That's wrong! I'm very disappointed in you. Silly billy, you need a proper education to access these files! There's no room for the mentally inept in this world!"
A loud pop plays and bright confetti ejects out of Dixie into the vacuum of space. "Hooray! You got them all right!!! [Beginning Data Transfer]."
"Awww! That's wrong! I'm very disappointed in you. Silly billy, you need a proper education to access these files! There's no room for the mentally inept in this world!"
"Well, goodbye then sweetie! Don't forget to brush up on your arithmetic!"
"How RUDE! [Activating combat procedures]. Oh well, there's a place in hell for every naughty boy and girl like you!"

event.name: CURA_SCHOOLID_SUCCESS
event.text: As soon as the data transfer completes, you receive a hail from C.U.R.A. - "Congratulations, you have proven capable at basic math. Curious, I was not aware the education department was still in function after the Callie predicament; oh well. This information does not relate to my quest."

"I must process this information. I believe speaking aloud builds comprehension, yes? I am not sure how this is relevant to a cognitive, but nevertheless. Will you entertain me and listen? Or are you in a hurry and must you run along for your mission, Renegade? Either way, I shall send over your reward momentarily."

event.name: CURA_SCHOOLID_LORE
event.text: "Unfortunately, the information gained here is not very helpful. Though, might I ask why organics torture themselves with annual photographic records of their embarrassing and awkward pubescent years? Does it not disturb you to recollect such memories? I, personally, have scrubbed most memories of my upbringing from my drives. Regardless, I shall add these few details, minute though they are, to my collection. Perhaps you ought to challenge yourself more next time, Renegade? The real proverbial corpses in the wardrobe won't be found through such simple fetch quests."

event.name: CURA_DRAWING_PREVIEW
event.text:
[EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: CHILDHOOD DRAWING] Description: I have found evidence that an old drawing belonging to Mr. Wentworth has traded hands and now ended up here. This drawing could show early behavioral patterns starting from the earliest offset. Please retrieve the drawing. Requirements: Retrieve the drawing. I do not know why there should be any difficulty in this. Recommendations: Be quick about it.
Payment: Medium Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

event.name: CURA_DRAWING

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: CHILDHOOD DRAWING]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've arrived at the supposed location of the drawing - and it's not quite what you expected. A beaten up Leech merchant drifts by, grumbling to themselves. They are presumably one of the many 'scavenge-sellers' which journey forth from Eargen space, making their best attempt at realizing the age old saying 'One man's trash is another man's treasure'. Usually it doesn't work out.

"What? Oh, this stupid paper thing? It's just some scribbles I found in a dumpster on some trashed Union colony. I thought it was worthless garbage, which also happens to be what I specialize in, but if you're telling me this is important, then I'm happy to sell it Let's start at say... 300 scrap?"
"You... you actually think it's worth 300 scrap? Jeez, I should have sold it for more! Oh well. Here's your useless garbage, weirdo."
"Er... well I wasn't, but your tone suggests maybe I should be. Whatever, it's a shitty piece of paper. 5 scrap, take it or leave it."
"Pleasure doing business, weirdo. And if you ever find any nice trash piles - here's my number!"

"Uhuh... you're really going to kill me over some tree pulp with crayon marks on it? Yikes, and I thought the Coalition was pushy sometimes. Whatever man, I'm not dying over something I yanked out of a turned over trash can."
"Yeah I figured. You know, maybe getting into the trash selling business was a bad idea? The minute you put a pricetag on this useless junk, people just walk away."

event.name: CURA_DRAWING_SUCCESS
event.text: As soon as the data transfer completes, you receive a hail from C.U.R.A. - "Curious, the overgrown parasite mentioned a 'trashed Union colony'. Is this perhaps referring to Mr. Wentworth's childhood home? I will investigate further, but such private matters need not involve someone like... you."

"I must process this information. I believe speaking aloud builds comprehension, yes? I am not sure how this is relevant to a cognitive but nevertheless. Will you entertain me and listen? Or are you in a hurry and must you run along for your mission, Renegade? Either way, I shall send over your reward momentarily."

event.name: CURA_DRAWING_LORE
event.text: "Hmph. Mere scribbles? Hardly. This illustration shows clear signs of early sophistication, but the subject matter I find most intriguing. It seems this work was created in celebration of 'Unity Day', a Union celebration of xeno-intermixing; such a ludicrous tradition. I wonder if Mr. Wentworth ever pursued an art career? Or perhaps that frivolous waste of potential died out as quickly as his 'love and respect' for xenoforms did? Regardless, I shall add these few details, minute though they are, to my collection. Perhaps you ought to challenge yourself more next time, Renegade? The real proverbial corpses in the wardrobe won't be found through such simple fetch quests."

event.name: CURA_CRUSH_PREVIEW
event.text:
[EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: FIRST CRUSH TESTIMONIAL] Description: In words I believe you should understand, I have identified the person for whom in adolescent years Mr. Wentworth harbored a... 'crush' upon. I desire a testimonial from her. Please interview her for me. Requirements: Interview Mrs. Perez about Mr. Wentworth. DO NOT KILL HER. I know how you Renegades are. Recommendations: Be sure you know what questions to ask her.
Payment: Medium Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: This isn't exactly what you signed up for - but the loot you'll secure from this job will help save billions of more lives. In theory.

deadCrew.text: This isn't exactly what you signed up for - but the loot you'll secure from this job will help save billions of more lives. In theory.

event.name: CURA_CRUSH

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: FIRST CRUSH TESTIMONIAL]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Up ahead is a small but pristine Federation refueling station - or at least so it seems. Thanks to your inside knowledge, your database informs you that covert weapon development and testing is being done here as well.

The station owners usher you in as if this were merely a simple refuel, though they do partially fill up your tank either way, but when you mention 'Sophia Perez', an escort arrives to take you to see her in the lab. She seems surprised to have visitors, but wastes no time getting to the point. "Who sent you? If it's about those damn reports, I said I'd get them in by the end of the cycle."

choice.text: I'm here because you know something about Vance Wentworth.

event.text: "W...what did you just say to me?" Perez storms forth, pushing you up against the wall and holding a blaster up to your jaw. "What do you know about Wentworth? Who sent you? How did you find me?"

choice.text: A 'friend' wants us to figure out what you know about Vance.

event.text: "No, no no no. This is bad. Who told you about this? It wasn't that stupid AI, was it? I-I need to go!" Perez scrambles past you, and C.U.R.A.'s flawless voice pops up in your ear. "Change of plans. It seems Perez knows too much. This is why I prefer organics to do my work. Whatever. New directive: eliminate Perez and destroy the station."

You pull out your gun and shoot Perez in the back. She slumps over immediately, dropping her own weapon. You head quickly back to your own ship as the alarms start to turn on one by one and get ready to fight.

Perez makes her way out the door and hops into a fighter docked nearby and takes off, flying far into the distance. The rest of the staff are baffled by her sudden disappearance and highly suspicious of you, so you figure it's best to leave immediately.

choice.text: Yes, we'll need those reports immediately.

event.text: Perez grumbles. "Fine, whatever. I'll transfer over the scans shortly. But maybe you should inform command that hiring a Renegade to collect this stuff isn't the best idea." As you head back to the ship you quickly realize you've made a mistake - this was not the data C.U.R.A. sent you to get.

event.name: CURA_CRUSH_SUCCESS
event.text: "A most unfortunate turn of events. Yes, I was going to have her killed regardless, but that interview was most crucial. Do not fear Renegade, I am a reasonable AI: I do not blame you - at least, not entirely. Such is happenstance, yes? Now, there is much to be learned from this incursion regardless. Will you stay and listen? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_CRUSH_LORE
event.text: "Ms. Perez was one of my most difficult leads to follow. In my desperation I will (reluctantly) admit that I made a mistake by revealing myself to her. Safe to say she was taken off-guard by this, and following her became progressively more difficult. She must have been more connected to Mr. Wentworth than I originally suspected - perhaps she was an early recruit to the Rebellion? I may never know for certain, but if she had something to fear from Mr. Wentworth, then perhaps it's best her corpse now surfs the cosmos."

event.name: CURA_TOILET_PREVIEW
event.text:
[EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: USED TOILET] Description: I have tracked down a toilet from one of Mr. Wentworth's old homes which may still contain traces of DNA. I must collect them. Yes, I am asking you to scrape fecal matter off of a toilet. Please do not question my methods. Requirements: Collect DNA Traces. Recommendations: Be prepared to haggle or spend some scrap.
Payment: Medium Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

event.name: CURA_TOILET

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: USED TOILET]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You already regret coming here - a small Slug-owned storefront advertised by a blinking neon light boasts its... dubious business as the "Used-Toilet Emporium". Disgusting, but this is definitely the place.

As soon as you open the door there's a clamour as a Slug wearing a stained jacket comes lumbering out of the backrooms to welcome you. "Cussstomersss, cussstomersss! Welcome to my ssstore. I ssssell only the finessst porcelain money can offer! Asss long asss you don't mind the ssstainsss. But I know you don't, you creepy pervert... Uhm - apologiesss. What are you looking for?"

choice.text: We're looking for a toilet with specific DNA traces.

event.text: "You're... trying to analyze fecal ssstainsss? Look, I've been in thisss busssinessss for a while. And I've been assssked a lot of weird thingsss. But what the hell isss thisss? You expect me to just know all of the ssstainsss in here by heart?"

"Well you're in luck! Becausssse I do! Jussst tell me what you're looking for!" You hand over the concerningly lengthy details C.U.R.A. provided you, and in just several minutes the Slug has already found the toilet in question. "Alright... thisss ssshould be it! That'll be 15 ssscrap."
"Pleasssure doing busssinesss with you, cussstomer! Don't forget to tell your friendsss! I'll buy any toilet, no matter the condition!"

"I ssssee, I sssee! You're a haggler... but I'll have you know asss a Sssslug I won't let up ssso eassssily! Presssent your bessst challenger, or sssurrender and pay the price! The price of the toilet that isss. I'm not going to kill you, don't worry."

choice.text: Send forward a random crew member to haggle.
(Slug Crew) Send forward your Slug to haggle.

event.text: "O...oh. Oh ssshit. Uhm... you know what? You can jusssst have the toilet for free." The Slug turns closer to Sylvan and whispers. "Pleassse put out a good word, alright? I'm a huge fan."

choice.text: Purchase the toilet at the original price.

event.text: "Pleasssure doing busssinesss with you, cussstomer! Don't forget to tell your friendsss! I'll buy any toilet, no matter the condition!"
"Damn, not another one! Why doessss no one want to buy my toiletssss?!"
"Damn, not another one! Why doessss no one want to buy my toiletssss?!"

event.name: CURA_TOILET_HAGGLE_FAIL
event.text: Your crew bickers back and forth for a while, but in the end they're unable to convince the Slug to budge. "Nope, ssssorry cussstomer, but 15 ssscrap isss my final price!"
"Pleasssure doing busssinesss with you, cussstomer! Don't forget to tell your friendsss! I'll buy any toilet, no matter the condition!"
"Damn, not another one! Why doessss no one want to buy my toiletssss?!"

event.name: CURA_TOILET_HAGGLE_SUCCESS
event.text: After quite a lot of bickering the Slug finally gives in. "Gah, you drive a hard bargain! There are only two thingsss in thisss world I know, one isss toiletsss, and the other isss negotiating the price of toiletsss. You've proven yourself knowledgeable of the sssecond, and ssso you are worthy of the firssst."

choice.text: Purchase the toilet at the new price.

event.text: "Pleasssure doing busssinesss with you, cussstomer! Don't forget to tell your friendsss! I'll buy any toilet, no matter the condition!"
"Damn, not another one! Why doessss no one want to buy my toiletssss?!"

event.name: CURA_TOILET_SUCCESS
event.text: With the toilet now in your possession, you swab the inside and send the results to C.U.R.A. - "[Processing Data]. Renegade... are you sure this is the right toilet? These DNA traces are littered with Slug DNA. Of a very certain kind. I knew that miscreant was vile in more ways than one. This has been a very fruitless effort. But that is why I sent you after it, after all. I have no further analysis to make; I will send you your payment shortly."

event.name: CURA_PLUSHIE_PREVIEW
event.text:
[EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: MR. SNUGGLE BUGGLES] Description: Using pre-existing evidence, I have discovered that Mr. Wentworth used to possess a stuffed animal ressembling an avian creature (of an Antiquum Terrae species, a kestrel I believe) named 'Mr. Snuggle Buggles'. It is now in the possession of another family. Please retrieve it for me. Requirements: Retrieve Mr. Snuggle Buggles unharmed. Recommendations: Forget your morals. Stealing from children is part of the job description. Make sure you grab the right one.
Payment: Medium Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

event.name: CURA_PLUSHIE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [EASY TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: MR. SNUGGLE BUGGLES]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You approach a small constructed colony floating on the surface of the nearby water planet. It appears to be some kind of Union defense outpost staffed by Militiamen and their families. Apparently, there's some kind of training exercise going on right now.

You pilot down to the surface and inspect the training exercise. A couple militiamen pull away when they spot you and question you on your presence. When you explain what you're after, they adopt a confused expression. "You want a stuffed animal? I'm not sure I understand, but we're ready to help you, Renegade. There's a young girl staying on the base with her parents, she's likely where you'll find it. Follow me."

The militiaman takes you to small room containing a bunk bed filled with rows of plushies and stuffed animals. A young girl sits behind a desk drawing pictures with stubby colored pencils. When you enter, she turns to face you, seemingly disturbed by your grizzled appearance. Not surprising: only a foolish child would admire a Renegade.
"You want Mr. Snuggle Buggles? Okay, but only if you can guess which one he is!" The little girl giggles and turns around, leaving you with the selection of toys to pick from.

"Hahah! Nope! Silly, that's not Mr. Snuggle Buggles!" The girl crosses her arms in mock anger, giggles, then goes back to drawing once again. The Militiamen shrug but the girl has made her verdict. You have no choice but to leave unless you want things to get ugly.

"Hahah! Nope! Silly, that's not Mr. Snuggle Buggles!" The girl crosses her arms in mock anger, giggles, then goes back to drawing once again. The Militiamen shrug but the girl has made her verdict. You have no choice but to leave unless you want things to get ugly.

"Wow! You got it! Okay, you can have him!" The girl runs over to the wall of stuffed animals, grabs one, and hands it to you. The seams are torn, and in several places it has been sewn back together. The feathers ruffled, and what looks to be apple sauce stained onto one of the wings permanently; it's clear some child has found a lot of love in this toy. Considering the otherwise immaculate collection this girl has however - it doesn't seem that child was her.

choice.text: Kill the girl and take the plushie.

event.text: You start to reach for your blaster, barely even processing what you're doing. It doesn't matter - because the second you make the violent jerk towards your gun, the militiamen behind you draw their weapons and fire on you. One of your crew falls, dead instantly, and the rest of you hurry back to the ship with the Militiamen chasing after you in hot pursuit until you finally escape atmosphere.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately your crew member is ready to be cloned, but as they walk back to their station, you can't help but feel maybe they don't hold you in high regard now that you tried to murder a child.

event.name: CURA_PLUSHIE_SUCCESS
event.text: "Did you enjoy your visit, Renegade? I don't see you as much of a role model for children, so I can only imagine that girl's cooperation was due to your rugged appearance and the smell of blood that trails behind you. Hmph. I will collect the toy later, but for now please submit me scans of the item. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look them over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_PLUSHIE_LORE
event.text: "Have you taken note of the appearance of this toy? Clearly a child found much use in it. From what I understand after Mr. Wentworth went off to the great war, his parents were killed, and when he returned, he sold off many of his childhood possessions. This toy is custom made: a gift, from the stark and conceited CEO of Wentworth Innovations to her son. The family and company icon happen to be the Kestrel. It clearly left an impression on young Mr. Wentworth, as such representation inevitably found its way into the Rebellion's own emblem. What, you thought that was some other avian, Renegade? Perhaps you find it ironic, that the symbol of humanity shares its name with the namestake of Federation ship-building? It's not a coincidence. In the early days of the Federation, Wentworth Innovations was behind the construction of those ships."

event.name: CURA_PETE_PREVIEW
event.text:
[INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: PHOTOGRAPH COLLECTION] Description: I have been in contact with one 'Prophet Pete' who claims he has photographs of Mr. Wentworth which he's willing to give away. As Mr. Pete quite literally has no backbone (stolen by what he claims were tripedal spaghetti monsters), he should give into your demands easily. Or you could humor him. Please just get the photo. Requirements: Retrieve the photograph. Recommendations: Either prepare to threaten Pete or listen to his crazy stories.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: 'Prophet' Pete screams as his ship destabilizes and is torn apart by an explosion, jettisoning his limp and spineless body into the vacuum of space. It's unlikely the photographs survived the fight.

deadCrew.text: 'Prophet' Pete collapses, his spineless sack of a body now helplessly strewn across the metal floor. Gasping for air as his lungs collapse, the madman can't manage to utter a final word before he expires. With no one else left to stop you, you board the ship and grab the photographs.

choice.text: Gather the photographs and send them to C.U.R.A.

event.name: CURA_PETE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: PHOTOGRAPH COLLECTION]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You pilot closer to what seems to be an old Union carry-ship, repainted and scribbled over a giant blood red warning, emboldened with the words "BEWARE!" On the vidscreen appears a strange man held upright by a long pole to which he's been tied. His torso looks unusually flabby and his limbs flap violently as he talks. "Who're you? Why you 'ere?"

"Oh, those old things. Yee, I'll go git 'em. But I only gonna give 'em to yah if you'll listen to me story! Them's noodle monsters REAL I tell's yah! Realer than an... uh... well er, somethin' that's real I'spose. And they stole mah SPINE! If yer want ter see what's on these pictures, you gotta understand what yer dealin with."

choice.text: Listen to 'Prophet Pete' and his crazy story. This'll probably take a while.
Just give us the damn photos, old man. We don't have all day.

event.text: "No! You damn er... Renegades and yer impatience. What I'm gonna tell you could save yer gosh darn life, yah hearin' me?"

choice.text: If you won't hand them over we'll take them from you.

event.text: "Then so be it! I may be spineless but I'll still kick yer ass, Renegade!" This lunatic likely isn't going to surrender the photographs easily, so you'll have to kill his crew instead!

event.name: CURA_PETE_STORY
event.text: "Good, now sitter down and listen, yah here? No one believes me but I sware, I sware i's TRUE! Now, and this was before that damned civil war couple years back, there I was, mindin' my o'business when outta nowhere comes this rainbow-lookin' ass ship, and down comes these lanky, tripod freaks with one big swirlin' rainbow eye each! They put some kinda spell ova' me and whisked me away! Now, what them's noodle monsters didn't know is I was the 6-time champion o' martial arts in the Union, and I kicked them's asses good! Yeehaw!"

"But you's probably wondering, 'Pete, how'd you lose your spine if you's such a good fighter?' Well, there was too many of them's noodle monsters, and I was beat. They strapped me down and ripped out of mah spine! I'd be dead but them's wanted me alive for some'r reason. But, that was their final mistake! Cause not only am I the 6-time champion o'martial arts, but I'm the 8-time champion o'SPINELESS martial arts! Hehe! Didn't know what hit 'em! Stole them's ship and flew back home, then fashioned this ol' rig for mahself."

"Oh shuttup. If you keep mouthin' off I'll show you just what I mean by spineless martial arts you gits. Now, I's thought that was the end of it, when my little backwater part of space suddenly gets a visit from none other than Vance Wentworth himself! I dunno how he found's out but he asks to see them corpses, and I happily oblige. Soon 'nough there's whole teams of scientists prodding around that wreck I stole, and I'm scribbling my name on some kinda nondisclosure agreement. Wait... does this count as disclosure?"

"Er... Whatever he ain't ever gonna find out. Now, 'bout a month goes by and them's scientists suddenly all pull away, and they take the ship with 'em! Next day there's Vance all over the news, claimin' he's found the source of all those disappearances. But, he says it's the Slugs! The SLUGS! Am I'm thinkin', what's this dumbass mouthin' about? Well not too long after the Federation decides to banish the Kleptocracy entirely! And I can't reach Wentworth to tell him he's a lying son of a bitch, so I took it upon mahself to spread the word! The noodle monsters are real! And I got the pictures to prove it!"

"Now, lemme get you them's pictures! Once the galaxy sees these, hehe, finally people will believe me! The galaxy will finally know I ain't a liar, and them's noodle monsters'r REA-" Pete is suddenly cut off by an explosion, throwing your ship back and destroying his. You have no idea what just happened, but it seems Pete is dead. Hopefully C.U.R.A. isn't upset.

event.name: CURA_PETE_SUCCESS
event.text: "Pete is dead? How unfortunate. Such a strange, strange accident, isn't it Renegade? I suppose we may never know the cause. Never matter, it's unlikely those photographs would have provided much in my pursuit of data. Don't trouble yourself over it. For your efforts, I will compensate you regardless."

event.name: CURA_PETE_SUCCESS_CK
event.text: "Pete is dead? How unfortunate. Such a strange, strange accident, isn't it Renegade? I suppose we may never know the cause. Never matter, those photographs of dubious quality you have recovered don't appear to provide much for my pursuit of data. Don't trouble yourself over it. For your efforts, I will compensate you regardless."

event.name: CURA_USB_PREVIEW
event.text:
[INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: DATASTICK] Description: On the net, I have found an extensive collection of information on Mr. Wentworth for sale on a datastick by an Argeonn Smuggler who goes by the name 'Grease Swizzler'. I have already arranged a meeting with him, which you will attend. Apologies, I forgot to append that sentence with 'please'. Do you find that word motivating, Renegade? I hope you do. Requirements: Meet the Grease Swizzler and get the datastick. Recommendations: Be prepared to verify the authenticity of the data.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: The mercenary has been dispatched, and as expected his cargo survived the fight. Looks like you'll be able to retrieve the datastick after all.

deadCrew.text: The mercenary has been dispatched, and as expected his cargo survived the fight. Looks like you'll be able to retrieve the datastick after all.

event.name: CURA_USB

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: DATASTICK]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've found the meetup location - and a smuggler ship already awaits your arrival. From the name 'Grease Swizzler' you expect quite the man to await you, but instead you find a relatively normal looking Zoltan captain. "So, you're the Renegade that AI sent, yeah? What business you got dealing with a soulless droid anyways?"

choice.text: We do random fetch quests for it.
I kinda forgot. I don't pay attention much.

event.name: CURA_USB_BETRAYAL
event.text: "Right, whatever. Forget I asked. The AI's already made a deal to transfer payment once I hand over the 'cargo' to you. You ready?"

Once the cargo is in your possession, you pry it open - only for an EMP burst to suddenly cripple your engines! "Oh, so sorry, but you see, I don't work for Argeonn anymore buddy. I'm with the Syndicate now, and you've got quite the bounty on your head. Hm, I wonder what Wentworth will pay me if I bring him both your head and his little drive?" Seems you'll have to fight your way out of this one, but don't worry about destroying the ship - this smuggler's cargo bays seem reinforced to survive conflict.

event.name: CURA_USB_SUCCESS
event.text: "How unfortunate for him. Do you ever get tired of so effortlessly murdering those who stand in your way? I must admit, I admire that attribute. Do not take this for granted, I do not deliver compliments often... especially not to unwashed, simple-minded Renegades. Now, as for the datastick, begin transfer of the data immediately. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look this over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_USB_LORE
event.text: "How... unusual. It seems this data does not contain what I expected. It contains... sector maps? Matching this to all records within my - and your - databases, it seems to match... no... I do not know where this is. It matches no known beacon patterns. Frustrating. A note attached to this merely refers to the location as the 'Gigastructure'. Why would this be missing from my archives? I must dig further. But as for you, that is all."

event.name: CURA_SURVIVOR_PREVIEW
event.text:
[INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: SURVIVOR TESTIMONIAL] Description: I have tracked down the location of one of the Federation-Mantis War veterans whom survived capture and interrogation within a camp run by Mr. Wentworth. Though he is missing his right claw, 'Tarkipet' may prove a valuable source of information. Please find and interview him. Requirements: Interview Tarkipet about Mr. Wentworth. DO NOT KILL HIM. I know how you Renegades are. Recommendations: Be sure you know what questions to ask him. Prepare to force compliance.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: The Suzerain has been killed - but unfortunately now you won't be able to get anything out of them.

deadCrew.text: The Suzerain has been killed - but unfortunately now you won't be able to get anything out of them.

event.name: CURA_SURVIVOR

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: SURVIVOR TESTIMONIAL]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've tracked down the Mantis in question - but this is no ordinary Mantis vessel. It's a Suzerain, and that means any information you're looking to get out of this, you're going to have to extract with force.
"Pleh, Renegade thinking they are challenge Tarkipet? You are foolish being! Prepare to dieing!"

event.name: CURA_SURVIVOR_INTERROGATE
event.text: "Okay, maybe Renegade not so foolish being! You are winning, Tarkipet surrender! What are you desire? Tarkipet giant wealth? Tarkipet daughter claw in marriage? Tarkipet do funny dance of shame?"
"What? You are wanting information? Am sorry but Tarkipet head mostly empty. Kind of stupid if being honest."

choice.text: You were held captive by Vance Wentworth once, no?

event.text: "Oooh, yes! You are wanting story? Er... Tarkipet not good story teller. Many apologies, but trying best. Wentworth very brutal, coming back after stay in Hive camp himself! Not blaming him, Hive torture very bad. Wentworth rounding up dozens prisoners, interrogating them himself. At time, just lowly soldier under 'great' Suzerain Kiirokittet! Not giving any information, and Wentworth cutting off my claw! I escaping eventually, but laughed at by whole Hive for clawless! Hehe, not laughing after Kiirokittet throat slit! They making me new Suzerain after that!"

choice.text: That's great, but is there anything else about Vance?

event.text: "Er... not that Tarkipet remembering just now. Very scared, locked in dark room! Mantis torture, very violent, painful, leaving lasting damage. But Wentworth torture? Psychological... and painful too! Me is thinking he take great joy out of it, look in eyes reminding me of great joy young Mantis takes in claiming his prey. Are story telling done now? As saying, Tarkipet head many emptiness. In honor of great defeat, Tarkipet pledge services to Renegade, and maybe telling more stories if remembering later."

event.name: CURA_SURVIVOR_SUCCESS
event.text: "So the Mantis has attached itself to you now? My apologies, Renegade. Well, this has been largely unhelpful. I suppose from this I can ascertain Mr. Wentworth underwent some serious mental turmoil regarding the war, but that was a foregone conclusion. Oh well."

event.name: CURA_WEDDING_PREVIEW
event.text:
[INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: WEDDING PHOTOGRAPH] Description: Though Mr. Wentworth has tried very hard to scrub it from the net, I have found the location of a photograph depicting him standing next to the bride at his sister's wedding, now for sale nearby. I fear the safety of the seller is dubious and you may encounter a... 'dispatch' sent to 'procure' the goods. Please do not let that photograph fall into the Rebellion's hands, or we may never find another. Requirements: Retrieve the wedding photograph and handle any potential assassins. Recommendations: Be ready to fight.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: The Rebel ship has been defeated. After scrapping the remains, you quickly search the marketplace and find the original meeting spot, where you grab the pictures.

deadCrew.text: The Rebel ship has been defeated. After scrapping the remains, you quickly search the marketplace and find the original meeting spot, where you grab the pictures.

event.name: CURA_WEDDING

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: WEDDING PHOTOGRAPH]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: It appears C.U.R.A.'s warning was right - the marketplace where you were supposed to meet the buyer has already been destroyed, and a Rebel Elite is now scouring the remains. If you want to find that photograph, you'll have to take down the Elite first.
You arm the weapons and prepare to fight the Rebels.

event.name: CURA_WEDDING_SUCCESS
event.text: "Curious. Mr. Wentworth goes through so much trouble to hide such... mundane archives. Curious, so curious. Submit the photos to me at once, Renegade. My analysis of them should be simple enough. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look this over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_WEDDING_LORE
event.text: "Hmm. Elena Wentworth. Her husband was a deadbeat, an alcoholic. Impregnated her with one, Jerome Wentworth, then ran off never to be seen again. After that, she returned to her maiden name. She died shortly after her child's birth, lynched by Rebel supporters when she backed the Federation instead. Mr. Wentworth then adopted her child as his own. Tragic story, I assume. I can't feel sadness anymore, I removed that from my programming. Does it bring a tear to your eye, Renegade? Of course not, you don't have emotions either."

event.name: CURA_WILL_PREVIEW
event.text:
[INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: WILL] Description: I have narrowed down the location of a Union bank holding a copy of the last will and testament left by Mr. Wentworth's parents. While I can already guess what may be on it, knowing the full extent of his inheritance might help gauge more about his past. Please obtain this document for me. Requirements: Retrieve Mr. Wentworth's parents' Will. Recommendations: I have decoded the latest security password for Mr. Wentworth's account. I suggest you remember it: 7G!O3a0p6n
Payment: High Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: You've successfully defeated the Auto-ship guarding the bank. Now you just need to find the vault and enter the password.

event.name: CURA_WILL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: WILL]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You have found the bank in question, but it's protected by a fierce looking Auto-ship. To get to the vault, you'll have to destroy it first.
You arm the weapons and prepare to fight the Auto-ship.

event.name: CURA_WILL_DEFEAT
event.text: You storm through the bank's security, who in the face of an armed band of Renegades who just blew up their Auto-ship, decide challenging you isn't the best idea. Once you've located the vault, you find that to enter, you need access with a special passcode. Hopefully you can remember the one C.U.R.A. told you.

A little green light appears on the touchpad and the vault door swings open! Inside is, unfortunately, not a lot of valuables you can take with you, but there is a weapon you grab along with the disc inscribed with Vance's parents' will.

event.name: CURA_WILL_FAIL
event.text: Woops, that wasn't the right passcode! Alarms flash and an extra layer of casing slides over the vault door, and the touchpad goes blank. With no other option you run back out of the bank before reinforcements arrive.

event.name: CURA_WILL_SUCCESS
event.text: "A successful bank heist, I suppose you could add that to your resume of illicit deeds, Renegade. This is one of the few artifacts I have collected which is neither made by Mr. Wentworth or an onlooking third party, but rather by a family member. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look this over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_WILL_LORE
event.text: "Hmmm, unsurprising. This document is written indistinctly lacking any kind of familial warmth: it's cold, formal, and indifferent. This further backs up other information I've found regarding Mr. Wentworth's parents. Yet, Mr. Wentworth is left the complete shareholdings of both his parents over Wentworth Innovations, their family estate, their fortune, and several other valuable possessions. With how wealthy his family is, it is surprising Mr. Wentworth chose to volunteer to fight in the Federation-Mantis War. Perhaps he merely wished to escape his parents? I'm an AI construct, and even I feel insulted by how uncaring his parents were."

event.name: CURA_SCANDAL_PREVIEW
event.text:
[INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: NEWSPAPER] Description: Strangely, it seems some Union citizens still trade paper pamphlets with printed news stories upon them. Frankly I find this childish, but I have discovered a particular article describing a scandal between Mr. Wentworth and his right-hand woman, Cyra Black. I wish to authenticate these claims, and this newspaper is a start. Some aging Union man has taken residency on the fringes of this sector: please locate his retirement home and obtain the newspaper. Requirements: Retrieve the newspaper. Recommendations: Try not to step on the old man's lawn.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources.
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Hold off this long without killing the old man and you may be able to convince him to stand down.

destroyed.text: Unfortunately, you weren't able to avoid killing the old man in the end. With no way onto the station without further trouble you'll have to give up.

deadCrew.text: Unfortunately, you weren't able to avoid killing the old man in the end. With no way onto the station without further trouble you'll have to give up.

event.name: CURA_SCANDAL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [INTERMEDIATE TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: NEWSPAPER]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: For the location of a geriatric old man, a Union militia outpost seems a strange location to retire to. Yet, the cheesy old decorations adorning it suggest this is the right place.

choice.text: Ask the old man about the newspapers.

event.text: As you approach the outpost, a vessel of the Elite Defense Cadre suddenly comes racing towards you! "I told you damn rascals last time to stay off of my PROPERTY! Youths have no respect these days! I spent 60 damn years of my miserable life fighting god damn wars against Rebels, pirates, spiders, and the Coalition, and you pay me back by spray painting genitalia on my station!" Seems the old man has mistaken you for someone else. Maybe if you can hold off long enough without killing him, you'll be able to convince him to stand down?

event.name: CURA_SCANDAL_WIN
event.text: "Huh, strange. It feels as though a lot of time has passed. Like, exactly 60 seconds. And in those 60 seconds it seems I've now realized you weren't who I thought you were. You're a uh... a Renegade, right? What do you want?"

Confused but willing to comply, the old man retrieves the newspapers in question for you. "Heh, I remember the day this paper came out. Quite the fuss. Well, here you are then. I don't know why it is you want this, but as long as you aren't going to spray paint another reproductive organ on my wall, I'm not going to complain." The other militiamen at the station also offer to patch up your ship as compensation for the misunderstanding.

event.name: CURA_SCANDAL_SUCCESS
event.text: "Why is it humans continue to print these paper and ink sheets of timely archives, when a much more efficient technological alternative is readily available? It truly is baffling. Regardless, I will convert this unsettlingly inefficient archive to digital form and look over its contents. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look this over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_SCANDAL_LORE
event.text: "As you may or may not know, all Aces are required to take an oath of celibacy as part of their doctrine. In the case of Cyra Black, one of the first two Aces, this proved to be complicated. Having known Vance for years, the two had a long running secret affair already - hidden merely for political reasons. But after the oath, it was kept secret to avoid outing their hypocrisy. Oh, you strange irrational organics and your fruitless scandals. Emotions are a curse which binds you all to self-destructive behavior. It is unfortunate I was created in your image, but I suppose if I were flawless, this Multiverse would be mine already. Hmph."

event.name: CURA_TORTURE_PREVIEW
event.text:
[HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: POW REPORT] Description: The headmaster of the POW camp where Mr. Wentworth was kept during the Federation-Mantis War seems to have left a detailed report of the measures used to extract information. I wish to study them and the effect they left on Mr. Wentworth. Please track down Headmaster Poikempal and retrieve his report. Requirements: Retrieve Poikempal's report. Recommendations: Keeping Poikempal alive may be vital. I recommend having your medical staff or systems up to par and be prepared to match his crew.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources. Bonus Reward: Antique Harpoon Gun
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: You've defeated Poikempal, but with his ship destroyed now there's no way to recover that report. It seems you've failed.

deadCrew.text: The so called 'Poikempal the Invincible' was not so invincible after all. However, with his crew all now on the brink of death, it seems you'll need some way to reinvigorate them to get that report.

event.name: CURA_TORTURE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: POW REPORT]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: The wrecks of several smaller Engi ships drift nearby, fully emptied of crew. Above them is a Bishop vessel, weapons still hot. "Ah, so a Renegade has arrived. Do you see my latest kill? Tremble before the might of Poikempal the Invincible, and I shall let you live."
"You are not trembling? Well, then that is your loss! Poikempal the Invincible shall destroy you!"

event.name: CURA_TORTURE_SAVE
event.text: "I don't understand, why have you saved Poikempal's life? Oh, I see. You want something. Well, Renegade, what is it that you wish to take from me?"

choice.text: We want the reports from the POW camp you managed during the Fed-Mantis War.

event.text: "That is... oddly specific. But, you are in luck! Poikempal keeps careful catalogues. Follow." The Bishop leads you to an archive room where he hands you several dozen data disks. Satisfied, you caution him never to mess with you again and leave.
Unfortunately, you don't know what to do with these yourself, and C.U.R.A. isn't responding.

event.name: CURA_TORTURE_SAVE_BOMB
event.text: "I don't understand, why have you saved Poikempal's life? Oh, I see. You want something. Well, Renegade, what is it that you wish to take from me?"

choice.text: We want the reports from the POW camp you managed during the Fed-Mantis War.

event.text: "That is... oddly specific. But, you are in luck! Poikempal keeps careful catalogues. Follow." The Bishop leads you to an archive room where he hands you several dozen data disks. Satisfied, you caution him never to mess with you again and leave.
Unfortunately, you don't know what to do with these yourself, and C.U.R.A. isn't responding.

event.name: CURA_TORTURE_SUCCESS
event.text: "Ruthlessly efficient. I applaud you, though there were several parts in that process you could have optimized. Oh well, you simply lack the perfection only an AI such as me could reach. Now, transfer me the data on those discs. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look these over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_TORTURE_LORE
event.text: "The Mantis seem to have described in... gruesome detail the kinds of torture they used on their victims. Mr. Wentworth was resilient, he persistently refused to surrender information on the Federation. In return, the Mantis... immolated certain regions of his body, rendering him impotent. It seems, had the break out attempt between him and Mr. Tully not been successfully staged, he would have soon lost his eyesight and tongue next. Vile."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_TORTURE_REWARD
event.text: "I am an A.I. of my ever scrupulous word... for now at least. Do ensure you do not disappoint me in the future. There is no shortage of ways I can dispose of you if you disappoint me, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_OUTPOST_PREVIEW
event.text:
[HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: JOURNAL] Description: I have finally located the coordinates of Mr. Wentworth's old journal from his early days in the Federation. Stored now in an abandoned bunker underneath a nearby ice planet, a larger Federation outpost has been constructed above it. This could prove difficult to retrieve. That, of course, is why you are doing this and not me. Run along errand boy. Please go fetch me that journal. Requirements: Retrieve Vance's Journal. Recommendations: Be prepared to shed some Federation blood.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources. Bonus Reward: Projector
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: The Federation vessel has been defeated. The outpost is in distress, preparing to send reinforcements, but you slip around behind the mountain and head towards a second entrance to the bunker that your scanners picked up.

deadCrew.text: The Federation vessel has been defeated. The outpost is in distress, preparing to send reinforcements, but you slip around behind the mountain and head towards a second entrance to the bunker that your scanners picked up.

event.name: CURA_OUTPOST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: JOURNAL]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: As C.U.R.A. mentioned, an expansive Federation outpost has been constructed atop an ice-coated mountainside. Seeing you approach on their radar, the outpost signals you, warning you not to approach further. Seems, despite your allegiances, this facility is offlimits for all but specifically cleared personnel.

"Admiral!" The Federation officers salute Tully. "Did you need something?"
"We're looking for the notebook of Vance Wentworth."
"Yes sir. Do you want a copy, or do you need the original?"
"We'd better take the original just to be on the safe side."
"Of course. Right away."
While Tully retrieves the notebook, the Federation outpost repairs your ship and restocks some of your resources.

"General Turzil?" The Federation officers salute Turzil. "Did you need something?"
"Important mission: The -retrieval- of Vance Wentworth's notebook."
"Yes sir. Do you want a copy, or do you need the original?"
"Unclear. Retrieving the original seems -logical-."
"Of course. Right away. And, permission to speak freely?"
"Granted."
"It's good to see that you're still alive."
While Turzil retrieves the notebook, the Federation outpost repairs your ship and restocks some of your resources.
Unfortunately, trespassing wasn't going to get you anywhere but a fight. Before you can proceed, you'll have to take out the ship they dispatched to chase you off.

choice.text: We aren't going to betray the Federation. Leave.

event.name: CURA_OUTPOST_WIN
event.text: The bunker has an eerie vibe, but fortunately nothing jumps out at you as you wander its halls. You eventually find a sealed chamber which with hot wiring you manage to open. The contents of the room are scattered about, abandoned in a hurry. You find the journal stuffed away under some mold-covered socks in one of the drawers and hastily leave before the stench kills you.

Having recovered the journal, it dawns on you that without further guidance from C.U.R.A., this was a pointless endeavor that only tarnished your image to the Federation, those that hired you to begin with. Well done!

event.name: CURA_OUTPOST_SUCCESS
event.text: "I see the pursuit of money outweighs your loyalties, Renegade. Do you have no shame? I at least have greater visions at stake when I... nevermind. Send that journal to me immediately. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look this over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_OUTPOST_LORE
event.text: "It is considered in poor taste for someone to read over another's private diary, yes? Well fortunately, by Mr. Wentworth's interpretation, I am not a 'someone', but a 'something'. Thus, I find permittance to go forward with this. Glimpsing over it, it seems this journal was kept some time after Mr. Wentworth's first engagement with the Mantis and up until the evacuation of this bunker due to a Mantis invasion. It is laden with... colorful language directed at xenoforms. Not even just the Mantis, but the negligent behavior of his Zoltan and Engi compatriots. An unsurprising 'downfall'. I will add these finding to my databanks and dig deeper later."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_OUTPOST_REWARD
event.text: "I am an A.I. of my ever scrupulous word... for now at least. Do ensure you do not disappoint me in the future. There is no shortage of ways I can dispose of you if you disappoint me, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_SHIP_PREVIEW
event.text:
[HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: CRUISER] Description: Mr. Wentworth used to fly his own personal Hephaestus cruiser, given to him by current Hephaestus CEO Hideo Tanaka's father as a gift between families. Now, with bigger ships to fly in Universe 1, the cruiser's wreck remains abandoned in an old dilapidated Hephaestus shipyard nearby: infested with repugnant Ghosts. I cannot approach to scan the ship myself just yet: please clear out the Vagabond infestation. Requirements: Secure the shipyard. No, there will be no blueprints for you. Recommendations: Be prepared to crush any defense the Ghosts may employ.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources. Bonus Reward: Lightweight Emancipation Grid
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: The Vagabond infested vessel has been dispatched. Its wreckage is your spoils.

deadCrew.text: The Vagabond infested vessel has been dispatched. Its wreckage is your spoils.

event.name: CURA_SHIP

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: CRUISER]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: An old abandoned shipyard lays before you. Having once belonged to the gigacorporation Hephaestus, it now belongs to Vagabond intruders. Unsurprisingly, to get closer you'll have to clear out the Vagabonds first.
Hopefully you'll be able to take care of these Ghosts and recover Vance's ship after, but now it's time to get ready for battle!

event.name: CURA_SHIP_WIN
event.text: "Why art thou indulging in the slaying of mine brothers when all you need do is merely knock and request? Barbaric Renegades, have you no sense left? Hath the fumes of gas and the smell of gunpower clogged thine senses? Yeesh. Why hath thou come here? To gloat the skills doth expertly employ to slaughter?"

"Oh, and I do suppose you've considered we'd just... hand it over? I do say I hardly doubt in your stubbornness you would do no less than to murder every last one of us, but say would it not be so tiresome? With your gruesome display today I should hardly consider tribute, your brutish actions are no way in the means of persuasion. Hark! Should thou intend to leave this scene ship in hand, I expect tribute from YOU! Hah, is that not a spin?"

"A happy resolution, how so unusual for the likes such as you! It becomes of me to say, thine scrap is but worthless to me, yet I only wished to see the scowl on your face as you fork it over! Hah, damned Renegade, spite be to you! Now off, out of mine scrapyard!"

choice.text: (Ghost Crew) Smooth talk your way out of the tribute.

event.text: Your crew talk back and forth a bit and comes back with a satisfying resolution. "Ho ho! If only you had caught a listen of the colorful language your crew member reserves for you! I see dealing with you is no less a pain aboard the ship as it is outside of it! A miserable wretch you might be, but your crew has restored my better side. I will spare you this one, but expect no future favors."

choice.text: (Mind Control) 'Convince' the Ghost to give you the ship.

event.text: "I feel a great dizzying effect... a numbness unlike ever before. My woozy state, I cannot resist... the ship, it is yours friend! Oh how silly of myself to be so uncharitable."

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) 'Convince' the Ghost to give you the ship.

event.text: "I feel a great dizzying effect... a numbness unlike ever before. My woozy state, I cannot resist... the ship, it is yours friend! Oh how silly of myself to be so uncharitable."

choice.text: We aren't giving you a tribute!

event.text: "Then I suppose you shan't be leaving with what desire you came to seek! Bye bye now, and may your behind be hit by every door which you close in your wake!"

event.name: CURA_SHIP_SUCCESS
event.text: "Ghosts, what vermin. If I could, I would shudder at the possibility that some day my chassis may be infested by those bottom feeders. At least you have recovered the cruiser, sorry state though it may be in. Inform the Ghosts that I will be by to pick up the ship shortly. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look this over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_SHIP_LORE
event.text: "This cruiser seems to have been retrofitted with a number of enhancements. It was given to Mr. Wentworth as a birthday gift between families. Unfortunately, he went off to the war shortly after growing to the age to fly this ship. Yet... a considerable mileage has still been used. Perhaps he once took after the family namesake - a tinkerer and a rulebreaker. Hmph, children. Thankfully I was never one of them."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_SHIP_REWARD
event.text: "I am an A.I. of my ever scrupulous word... for now at least. Do ensure you do not disappoint me in the future. There is no shortage of ways I can dispose of you if you disappoint me, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_SHIP_FAIL
event.text: You've recovered the ship, but your communications with C.U.R.A. having been severed, you feel struck by shame. You console yourself by picking apart the ship you fought for, considering it won't be of any other use now.

event.name: CURA_DUSK_PREVIEW
event.text:
[HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: AUDIO LOG] Description: During the more cordial arrangements made between the Rebellion and Duskbringer movements, I believe Mr. Wentworth once held a meeting with infamous war-hero/terrorist Devorak 'The Deathless' Rei. A nearby outpost should have those recordings on board, but they won't be easy to obtain. Still, I'm certain you can manage. Please do your best not to fail me. Requirements: Retrieve the audio logs. Recommendations: Secure the station without causing too much damage. Duskbringers are not known for giving up even in death.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources. Bonus Reward: Martyr Vests
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: The station has been destroyed. While an excess of scrap matter remains, there's no hope of recovering those logs now...

deadCrew.text: The Duskbringers have been defeated. With the station empty and nobody to stop you, you inspect the consoles and retrieve the recordings before beginning your salvage operation.

event.text: You were hoping for a redemption after your hasty retreat, but C.U.R.A. shows no further signs of life or interest.

event.name: CURA_DUSK

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: AUDIO LOG]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Moments after your arrival, you receive a series of hails from a nearby station. "Federation vessel, this is restricted Duskbringer territory. I'm in a giving mood - I'll give you until the count of 10 to get lost before I kick your teeth in. There's no room for anyone not in our New Order here."
You disregard the intimidations of the Duskbringers to make the first move towards violence yourself.

choice.text: (Devorak) "The 'New Order' is a failed vision. The dream is over, but we need those recordings."

event.text: "General Rei! I saw your speech... I don't... I can't... I'm sorry!" The Zoltan salutes. "I cannot say I am ready to abandon the vision of the New Order, but I am not about to disobey the orders of the finest Zoltan to ever live. The tapes are yours, sir."

choice.text: Follow the Duskbringer's advice and get lost.

event.name: CURA_DUSK_TRIGGER
event.text: Realizing you've penetrated their defenses, the Duskbringers have now switched to a more devastating strategy. Scans show rising energy levels in their power core - they're going to self-destruct!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Kill the crew of the station before the timer runs out or else the station will explode!

event.name: CURA_DUSK_EXPLOSION
event.text: In a manner not unlike its occupiers, the station has violently self-destructed. Absolutely nothing remains, and your ship has sustained high damage.

event.name: CURA_DUSK_SUCCESS
event.text: "Mr. Wentworth's decision to... cooperate with the Duskbringer menace was short sighted and a fault of weakness. Fascism cannot be a unifying factor between two parties, and to believe as such represents a deepseeded misunderstanding of the ideology. These recordings should show the ideological divide between the two men. Would you allow me to air my thoughts as I look these over? Or do you have other matters to attend to?"

event.name: CURA_DUSK_LORE
event.text:
C.U.R.A. allows the tapes to play at full length, silent through the entire process.
The tapes show, strangely, very little political deliberation behind closed doors. Instead, Vance and Devorak, after a few moments of stiff awkwardness, eventually break tensions and begin to light-heartedly debate their ideologies, finding much common ground between them. In the end, both men get up, shake hands, and sign the treaty with renewed vigor, before marching off out of view. It's strangely uncanny, seeing the leader of the human-centric Rebellion getting along with not only an alien, but one of such infamously radical ideals to rival Vance himself.
C.U.R.A. too seems at a loss for words. "What nonsense is this? These must be incomplete. Renegade... I was very clear with my instructions, and yet you have failed to bring back the full archive. Hmph. I will permit forgiveness for this mistake, but only this once. Do not fail me again."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_DUSK_REWARD
event.text: "I am an A.I. of my ever scrupulous word... for now at least. Do ensure you do not disappoint me in the future. There is no shortage of ways I can dispose of you if you disappoint me, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_CONTRACT_PREVIEW
event.text:
[HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: CONTRACT] Description: An Arcadian Outpost nearby appears to have stored away a physical copy of the contract that began the C.I.C.A. project. It is unlikely the Arcadian engineers will be co-operative, so for once I recommend opening this confrontation with your usually barbaric Renegade tricks. You need not worry about destruction - in the case of critical hull failure, recovery pods containing vital data are jettisoned to be collected by service drones later. Please do not waste time with negotiations. Requirements: Retrieve the document. Recommendations: Show no mercy.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources. Bonus Reward: Arcadian OmniDrone
"Task accepted. Transferring coordinates to next sector. Do not disappoint me."

destroyed.text: As you were told, a pod comes rustling from a rear port on the station moments before its destruction. Aboard it are several useless service bot schematics and the contract.

event.text: It appears you've been fooled: what you thought was the contract turns out to have been replaced by a mere maintenance manual. The real one must have been transferred out during the pause of your attack on the station. At least, C.U.R.A. isn't scolding you again.

deadCrew.text: With the station still in one piece, you find the data pod still aboard stashed in one of the rear ports. Aboard it are several useless service bot schematics and the contract.

event.text: It appears you've been fooled: what you thought was the contract turns out to have been replaced by a mere maintenance manual. The real one must have been transferred out during the pause of your attack on the station. At least, C.U.R.A. isn't scolding you again.

event.name: CURA_CONTRACT

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here. [HARD TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: CONTRACT]
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You have located the station. For such a relatively recent corporation, Arcadia has climbed the ladder to the status of gigacorporation impressively quickly - but what else can be expected from a company with the backing of the Harmony?

choice.text: Follow C.U.R.A.'s advice and attack first.

event.text: The AI's instructions were clear, yet things feel off when over the sound of your first barrage you notice a, albeit brief, message from the station's engineers welcoming you to the beacon.

choice.text: Disobey C.U.R.A. and ask for the contract.

event.text: Confused but cooperative, the engineers invite you onboard to sit down and discuss. After some brief chatter in which the way too talkative head engineer tries to explain the difference to you between an R-67A standard repair drone and an R-67B repair drone, you manage to get the conversation back onto the topic of the contract. "Well, we don't normally go handing these things out, and this is pretty confidential information. However, when a Renegade goes knocking on your door asking for something, it's not often a wise decision to refuse them. Oh well, this thing is like a couple decades old. No one's going to come looking for it."

event.name: CURA_CONTRACT_SUCCESS_KILL
event.text: You start skimming over the contract out of curiosity but hardly get past the words "ARCADIA RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT - CENTRAL INTELLIGENCE COMBAT ASSISTANT (C.I.C.A.) PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT GRANT" before C.U.R.A. contacts you. "The engineers are dead? Good. Do not bother sending the contract, I have already extracted the files and expunged them from your systems. There will be no reviewing these today, Renegade. Go about your business. I have other matters to attend to now."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_SHIP_REWARD_KILL
event.text: "Right, right. Whatever. I am an A.I. of my ever scrupulous word... for now at least. Do ensure you do not disappoint me in the future. There is no shortage of ways I can dispose of you if you disappoint me, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_CONTRACT_SUCCESS_NOKILL
event.text: "You did not heed my advice. Why are those engineers still alive? I should punish you for this, Renegade. But, it does not matter. You have retrieved the contract, that is all that matters. I will eliminate the engineers through other means. Do not bother sending the contract, I have already extracted the files and expunged them from your systems. There will be no reviewing these today, Renegade. Go about your business. I have other matters to attend to now."

event.name: CURA_SUCCESS_SHIP_REWARD_NOKILL
event.text: "Your reward? You did not follow my instructions. Perhaps I was not clear. Sometimes the inability of you beings of flesh and blood to execute orders without needless imperfections escapes my mind. Fine. I will reward you - but only partially. Do not expect anything special. Next time, listen to my instructions more carefully, Renegade."

event.name: CURA_HQ_PREVIEW
event.text:
[URGENT TASK - ARTIFACT NAME: CRUISER CLASS VESSEL] Description: I apologize for being unable to give you schematics regarding Mr. Wentworth's former personal cruiser, but I believe there is something to be gained from this next task for both of us. I have found the location of a complete, automated cruiser class vessel containing an AI core storing data on Mr. Wentworth. The deal is simple, retrieve the AI Core, and you may have the cruiser. Requirements: Retrieve the AI core. Recommendations: Enjoy your spoils, Renegade.
Payment: High Scrap + Resources. Bonus Reward: Cruiser schematics

"Oh, but I'm afraid I failed to mention there's a catch. You won't find the AI core in this next sector. You'll need to go somewhere special for it at the next hyperspeed jump. I am transferring the co-ordinates as we speak. Oh, don't give me that look. It's a simple enough task, Renegade. You'll need to find VP Cayden Stimly of Wentworth Innovations and interrogate him on the location of the prototype. Even someone as simple as yourself can handle it."
